images.caption: Cypress-like Sedge – it grows on banks of stagnant and running waters in floodplain forests
Cypress-like Sedge – perennial herb forming clumps
Cypress-like Sedge – flowers are arranged in spikes – one terminal spike is male, other 3-4 lateral are female
Cypress-like Sedge – the fruits are bloated three-sided yellow-green perigynia, spikes with perigynia are pendant
Cypress-like Sedge – colorized drawing by Josef Dohnal
